definition: Calgary, largest city of Alberta, Canada
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: Stephen Herrero is a retired professor at the University of Calgary in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬雷羅是在加拿大卡爾加里大學的退休教授。

sentences.english: Massage Shop for sale in Calgary. Great location and cheap rental fee.
sentences.chinese: 卡爾加里按摩院出售出租，房租便宜，地段好。

sentences.english: Demand for executives is particularly high in Calgary.
sentences.chinese: 行政人員的需求在卡爾加里特別高。
